strategy: draft: You are an ML research agent working on a task.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine data for preprocessing
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Fill NaN values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
combined_df.fillna(imputer.fit_transform(combined_df), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = combined_df[:len(train_df)].drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = combined_df[len(train_df):].drop(columns=['Id'])

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine data for preprocessing
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Fill NaN values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
combined_df.fillna(imputer.fit_transform(combined_df), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = combined_df[:len(train_df)].drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = combined_df[len(train_df):].drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine data for preprocessing
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Fill NaN values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
combined_df.fillna(imputer.fit_transform(combined_df), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = combined_df[:len(train_df)].drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = combined_df[len(train_df):].drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.linear_model import SGDRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine data for preprocessing
combined_df = pd.concat([train_df, test_df], ignore_index=True)

# Fill NaN values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
combined_df.fillna(imputer.fit_transform(combined_df), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
combined_df = pd.get_dummies(combined_df)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = combined_df[:len(train_df)].drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = combined_df[len(train_df):].drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = SGDRegressor(max_iter=1000, tol=1e-3, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
